Additional XPath Data 2:
GARDEN CRESS
vs12
Common, fast growing variety with feathery leaves. For spring, autumn and for forcing in winter. Sow thickly. Do not cover seeds with soil, just tap the container, and keep moist for the first couple of days.
Colour: green

LAND CRESS
vs13
Large seed leaves, more productive compared to vs12. Hence it is possible to sow more thinly, which is a distinct advantage for forced cultivation in the wintermonths lacking light. Fast growing.
Colour: green

Additional XPath Data 2:
WATERCRESS
vs10
For cultivation the usual practice is to start the watercress as an annual in containers and then put these into running water. It is also possible to sow or plant into an evenly-moist bed. Tangy taste.
Colour: green

Explanations
ProSpecieRara: This variety has been awarded by ProSpecieRara as a rare or old variety. ProSpecieRara is a foundation dedicated to preserving the diversity of rare plant varieties. In long-term cooperation with ProSpecieRara, Sativa is active in the important preservation and cultivation of these traditional varieties.
Additional XPath Data 2:
WINTERCRESS
 vs11
Similar in taste to Water Cress. Rich in Vitamin C. Particularly suitable for growing in the winter months. Continous harvest is possible even when grown outdoors.
Colour: green
